Subjects: translations; hymns, to Christ; Christ, hymns to
_description: William Herebert’s translation of the hymn ‘Ihesu nostra redempcio’ — twenty-five lines in stanzas of varying length

BLAdd46919.First Lines: Iesu oure raunsoun loue and longyngeLouerd god almyhti whrouhte of alle þinge…
BLAdd46919.Last Lines: …Þou boc nou oure ioie þat shalt boen oure medeAnd oure woele ay boe in þe þat shalt ous wyth þen nede
BLAdd46919.Attributed Author: Herebert (Written in left margin beside first line, f. 209v)
BLAdd46919.Attributed Title: Ihesu nostra redemptor (written above text, in upper margin (f. 209v)
BLAdd46919.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 27-8.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 97.
